comment: Cayley's Theorem (constructive version): given group ` G ` , ` F ` is an isomorphism between ` G ` and the subgroup ` S ` of the symmetric group ` H ` on the underlying set ` X ` of ` G ` . See also Theorem 3.15 in [Rotman] p. 42. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 3-Mar-2008.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jan-2015.)
